00032 // This is the interface definition file for the abstract class
00033 // Vector. Vector is the parent class for List and Array.
00034 
00035 #ifndef _vector_h
00036 #define _vector_h 1
00037 
00038 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00039 #ifdef __GNUG__
00040 #pragma interface
00041 #endif
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 #ifdef WIN32
00045 #include <rpc.h>
00046 #include <winsock.h>
00047 #else
00048 #include <rpc/types.h>
00049 #include <netinet/in.h>
00050 #include <rpc/xdr.h>
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #ifndef _basetype_h
00054 #include "BaseType.h"
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifndef _dds_h
00058 #include "DDS.h"
00059 #endif
00060 
00088 class Vector: public BaseType {
00089 private:
00090     int _length;        // number of elements in the vector
00091     BaseType *_var;     // base type of the Vector
00092 
00093     // _buf was a pointer to void; delete[] complained. 6/4/2001 jhrg
00094     char *_buf;         // array which holds cardinal data
00095 
00096     vector<BaseType *> _vec;    // array for other data
00097 
00098 protected:
00099     // This function copies the private members of Vector.
00100     void _duplicate(const Vector &v);
00101 
00102 public:
00103     Vector(const string &n = "", BaseType *v = 0, const Type &t = dods_null_c);
00104     Vector(const Vector &rhs);
00105 
00106     virtual ~Vector();
00107 
00108     Vector &operator=(const Vector &rhs);
00109     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate() = 0; 
00110 
00111     virtual int element_count(bool leaves);
00112 
00113     virtual void set_send_p(bool state); 
00114 
00115     virtual void set_read_p(bool state);
00116 
00117     virtual unsigned int width();
00118 
00119     virtual int length();
00120 
00121     virtual void set_length(int l);
00122 
00123     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00124                bool ce_eval = true);
00125     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00126 
00127 #if 0
00128     virtual bool read(const string &dataset);
00129 #endif
00130 
00131     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00132 
00133     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00134 
00135     void set_vec(unsigned int i, BaseType *val);
00136 
00137     void vec_resize(int l);
00138 
00139     virtual BaseType *var(const string &name = "", bool exact = true);
00140 
00141     virtual BaseType *var(const string &name, btp_stack &s);
00142 
00143     virtual BaseType *var(unsigned int i);
00144 
00145     virtual void add_var(BaseType *v, Part p = nil);
00146 
00147     virtual void print_decl(ostream &os, string space = "    ",
00148                 bool print_semi = true,
00149                 bool constraint_info = false,
00150                 bool constrained = false);
00151 
00152     virtual void print_decl(FILE *out, string space = "    ",
00153                 bool print_semi = true,
00154                 bool constraint_info = false,
00155                 bool constrained = false);
00156 
00157     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "", 
00158                bool print_decl_p = true);
00159 
00160     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "", 
00161                bool print_decl_p = true);
00162 
00163     virtual bool check_semantics(string &msg, bool all = false);
00164 };

00221  * what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00222  * refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00223  * Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00224  * hierarchies of variables.

00228  * _duplicate().

00230  * EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00231  * should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00232  * for these to work in all cases.

00238  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00239  *
00240  * Revision 1.30  2000/09/21 16:22:09  jimg
00241  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00242  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00243  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00244  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00245  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00246  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00333  * deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00334  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).
